results.gold_evidence: The document lists 'Obtaining confidential information' as an example of 'obtaining or retaining business or an advantage in the conduct of business'.

results.gold_evidence: This policy was approved by the Board of Directors of Toyota Motor Corporation on September 29, 2021.

results.claim: Toyota's policy applies to all executives and employees in Toyota and its subsidiaries.
results.gold_evidence: This policy applies to all executives and employees in Toyota and its subsidiaries.

results.claim: Toyota has established a Human Rights Due Diligence system to identify, prevent, and mitigate negative human rights impacts.
results.gold_evidence: In order to fulfill the responsibility to respect human rights, we will establish and continuously implement a Human Rights Due Diligence* system. (*The process which is implemented for the identification, prevention, and mitigation of negative human rights impacts)

results.claim: Toyota's policy explicitly prohibits discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity.
results.gold_evidence: We do not tolerate any form of discrimination relating to gender, age, nationality, race, ethnicity, creed, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status or the presence of children.

results.claim: Toyota's human rights policy requires the company to use only international human rights standards when they conflict with national laws.
results.gold_evidence: If there is conflict between the standards, then we will strive to the utmost to respect internationally recognized human rights to the greatest extent possible.

results.claim: Toyota has already implemented remediation mechanisms for human rights violations in all countries where it operates.
results.gold_evidence: In addition to this, we will continue to develop and operate a practical remediation mechanism by expanding the function of our existing grievance mechanism which has been established in Japan and also in other regions.

results.claim: Toyota's policy states that the company will immediately implement corrective measures when it has caused adverse human rights impacts.
results.gold_evidence: If it is certain that we have caused or contributed to an adverse impact on human rights, we shall immediately implement corrective measures.

results.claim: Toyota's human rights policy specifically addresses risks related to migrant workers and forced labor in its supply chain.
results.gold_evidence: Due to the nature of our business, we also recognize the possible risks of forced labor involving migrant workers within our business, supply chain and value chain.

results.claim: Toyota's founding philosophy included paying taxes as a locally rooted company to create employment and enrich the local economy.
results.gold_evidence: Toyota's founding philosophy was to contribute to the national economy by establishing an automobile industry, by 'enriching people's lives through car making' and 'creating employment and enriching the local economy by paying taxes as a locally rooted company'.

results.claim: Toyota complies with the OECD Transfer Pricing Guidelines in all jurisdictions where it operates.
results.gold_evidence: Toyota complies with local applicable laws and regulations in all jurisdictions in which we operate our business as well as relevant international tax standards, such as the OECD Transfer Pricing Guidelines, arm's-length standards, as established by international organizations.

results.claim: Toyota's Chief Operating Officer is responsible for tax compliance.
results.gold_evidence: Tax compliance falls under the responsibility of the Chief Financial Officer. Across our businesses, Toyota ensures oversight and governance of tax matters through internal review and approval procedures by members of the Regional Tax Function, local entities and Executive Boards where appropriate.

results.claim: Toyota regularly reports highly important tax issues to its board of directors and Audit and Supervisory Board Members.
results.gold_evidence: These issues are reported and evaluated in our board of directors' meeting regularly. These issues are reported to Audit and Supervisory Board Members regularly as well.

results.claim: Toyota uses tax avoidance structures as part of its normal business operations.
results.gold_evidence: Toyota structures its normal business operations consistent with our low tolerance for tax risk and does not plan into tax avoidance structures outside of our normal business operations.

results.claim: Toyota aims to utilize tax incentives to optimize tax expense and improve shareholder value.
results.gold_evidence: In order to optimize tax expense and improve shareholder value, we aim to strengthen the above governance and utilize tax incentives in line with the business substance of our operations to provide sustainable results within the parameters of our strategic and commercial objectives.

results.claim: Toyota always resolves tax disputes with authorities without needing to proceed to legal procedures.
results.gold_evidence: Sometimes, however, it could be necessary for these differences in interpretation to proceed to national or supranational resolution procedures to clarify the interpretation of the law.

results.claim: Toyota adheres to the arm's length principles as defined by the OECD to prevent double taxation.
results.gold_evidence: Toyota adheres to the arm's length principles as defined by the OECD and allocates income according to business functions and risks appropriately in order to prevent double taxation.
